TopicTitle: Any more Dev Diaries or teasers in the next four months even if its something small like what the debug menu looks like?

Articles.Content:
Now that we know that Early Access is coming up it feels a bit limiting on what will be shown before release.

Personally I want/need the debug menu for testing KSP2. I don't want to have to go all the way to Eve to test a craft each time.

A debug menu like KSP1 would allow us to help with the early access phase so I am assuming it already exists.

Transporting to eve instantly using something like Set Position (or even better a craft loader directly from the debug menu would be great) so we can test water, wheels on eve vs Kerbin vs other planets etc would be a huge help.

I think this would mean the opposite, they'll finally have a general target for what to release info for.  I expect we will see a general ramp up in posts leading up to launch with one video giving a generic idea to the full vision of the game as it is so far. Mostly though I think the tidbits we will be provided will correlate to the upcoming first chapter and as EA is in function we will see updates on progress/changes based from the community over the current segment as it is being improved with previews to the new segment as the at time current segment is coming to a close.
